Setting up access permissions to document creation
The ability to work with print forms of the document is determined by the access permissions thereto.
You need to:
Display the button itself to create a print form
Allow users to work with the generated document template
A button to create a print form
A button, as a control, is an
action
in the System. Setting the required action is defined in the appropriate registry (for more information, refer to
Working with the object registry
).
To configure the display of the button to create a print form, you need to:
1. Go to the
Actions
registry in the System.
2. Select the
Print form
action. The System will display the object profile.
3. In the
Related object types
block of fields, use the
button to specify the type of object where the button will be displayed to create a print form.
Setting
Purpose
Name
Entering the setting name.
Algorithm of action visibility in the child object
Selecting/entering an algorithm to specify whether the button is visible in an object type.
Actions
Displaying the name of the custom action.
System attribute object type
Selecting the type of object in which you want to display the button to create a print form.
Override the action name
Entering the button name. By default, the button is called "Print form".
Override the action hint
Entering the hint text for the custom button.
4. Use
to save the settings in the object profile.
When all settings are entered, the System will display a button to create a print form in instances of the type specified:
Document template permissions
A document template, like any item in the System, is an object type. Permissions to System object types are provided in the same way (
more about this
).
So, to grant permissions to a document template, you need to:
1. Go to the
Access to System objects
registry. The System will display the registry of all objects.
2. Select the
Print form template
object type. The System will display a register of print form templates.
3. Select a
Custom template
from the list of print forms and allow the user/user group to take the necessary actions.
4. Use the
button to save the values entered.
If the document contains nested templates, you should configure permissions for them as well.
